results.description:
What is a "Rennie"?


In short: "Rennie" refers to people who are fans of Renaissance/Medieval Faires and Festivals.  We're not cast members, we're not market vendors...we're groupies.  Fans. Some are casual, only going once a year; others, like myself, go more often and have adopted a persona to portray (with outfit and accent to match) - but the main point is that we all love the magic of the Faire and that feeling as if we've gone back in time to an earlier place and century.

This group is meant to bring together people in the NYC area who have an interest in attending Renaissance Faires/Medieval Faires and related activities in and around city (or, for our purposes: Gotham.)  This includes our "home" festival in update Tuxedo Park, the New York Renaissance Faire, as well as those in New Jersey, Pennsylvania, and Connecticut.  It may also include events such as group outings to watch period or Fantasy related films and plays, or food and drink related to the early medieval-to late Renaissance eras.

Maybe you've thought about attending one, but don't know anyone else interested and don't want to go it alone.   Or perhaps you've gone in the past, or in another city, but don't have a regular group to go back with. Maybe you would just like to meet others here in the city with similar interests for ideas on costumes, weapons, or just general discussion on related topics. Or it could be you're just looking for information on who, where and when these types of events happen. 

Whatever your reason, join us! Cheer on your favorite knight, indulge in decadent ales, the sweetest meads and interesting foods, gander at the beautiful lords and ladies in their finest garb, join the dances, hear the music, enjoy the sights, scents, wares and entertainment of Medieval Gotham!

- Eric, aka Ariq ibn Rajih ibn Khali al Turkir
results.name: Gotham Rennies

Software Craftsmanship is described best by the Software Craftsmanship Manifesto (http://manifesto.softwarecraftsmanship.org):

"As aspiring Software Craftsmen we are raising the bar of professional software development by practicing it and helping others learn the craft. Through this work we have come to value:

Not only working software, but also well-crafted software

Not only responding to change, but also steadily adding value

Not only individuals and interactions, but also a community of professionals

Not only customer collaboration, but also productive partnerships

That is, in pursuit of the items on the left we have found the items on the right to be indispensable. "

Software Craftsmanship New York approaches Software Craftsmanship from a modern, freestyle, pragmatic way while keeping the values in focus.

We welcome developers, business analysts, project managers at any level who are interested in improving their skills via discussing interesting topics, challenging themselves with hands-on sessions, learning Test Driven Development, practicing katas, peeking into new technologies, languages and meeting with software professionals and thinkers who enjoy developing software and care about what they do.

results.description: Entrepreneurs are pitching all the time.  And there's some really interesting research showing how we can do it a little bit better.  The starting point though is understanding the purpose of a pitch.  Now I used to think that the purpose of a pitch was basically to convert the other side.  You do a little vaudeville routine, ba da da da, and then they agree with you.  That's not right.  There's some great research out of the University of California Davis and Stanford.  And what they found is the most effective pitchers didn't think of their pitch as an attempt to convert.  They looked at it as an invitation to collaborate.  It was an invitation, come on in with me and work on this idea, share with me your ideas on how we can make this better.  That's what a pitch is.  So don't think of it as an attempt to convert, think of it as an invitation to collaborate.
results.name: Pitch Your Startup (LIVE!)

results.description: Glad you found us! NY Tri-state SociABILITY, also known as Friday Night Live,  is for high functioning young adults, 21-29, seeking friendships and activities.  We changed the name since our activities take place on various days.  Some of our members have Aspergers, or learning disabilities, but are physically and mentally capable and eager to engage in the same activities as other young adults. Our sons/daughters go bowling, to the movies, plays, tubing, hiking, have even walked Manhattan's West Side bike path, and many drive. While family members often help plan outings, and arrange transportation for non-driving members, the young adults already possess the social skills to enjoy themselves without the presence of parents/caregivers. Please note, if you, your young adult, has more significant needs, this may not be the appropriate group, as we do not have any professional staff, just people gathering together for social time. This is a group run by, and for, our young adults, with a little organizational help from us caregivers. If your son/daughter wants to make friends to hang out with on the weekend, come join!

Mr. Harrington is bi-coastal teacher with 40 years teaching experience. Other voice teachers consult with him about problem voices, but his greatest joy is with beginners and those told not to open their mouths. Three blocks from Port Authority. Three blocks from Penn Station.
results.name: Voice Class for Individuals (Mid-Town)

results.description:
Who We Are

Education Idea Exchange NYC is a community of Educators, Entrepreneurs, Designers and Developers (as well as other Education Disruptors) who come together to foster innovation and disruption in the education space. This meetup is organized by 4.0 Schools, a nonprofit that brings together a similar community of people experimenting with new ideas in education -- from educators, entrepreneurs and creative technologists to parents and students.

Our Monthly Event 

In the first part of the night, 3-5 members working on an education venture or experiment share their progress, and get* feedback and help from the other meetup members. In the second half of the night, we open the floor for members to share what they can give* or what they need to get* (expertise, connections, feedback, etc).

get*:
• Feedback on your idea / prototype / MVP / venture
• People excited enough about your idea to join your team
• Connected to the 4.0 community (and the wider education disruption community in NYC)

give*:
• Your perspective on a problem and a potential solution 
 • Advice (pedagogy, problem validation, customer dev, feedback loops, product, etc)
 • Skills/time to ideas and people that really resonate with you
 • Access to your own network

If interested in sharing your venture or experiment, please fill out this form.
results.name: Education Idea Exchange NYC

results.description:
Welcome all nail fashionistas. 

This group is for nail bloggers and manicure enthusiasts nail artists, nail salon owners, nail techs, nail polish addicts. in the nyc area. We are starting this group to create a community around our passion, nail polish!

Share nail art, ideas, meet and greet, network within the industry

We will hold local shows at area venues to create opportunities to display your work and creativity! 

What better way to celebrate life than with beautiful nails, your best heels and of course a cocktail? It all started a few years ago in a nail salon. I loved the way my nails looked after they got done, but I hated waiting for the nail polish to dry. So I would buy the nail polish and try to polish them myself… Walah! Nail polish addict I became! How did the heels and cocktails come in? I wanted to make it a complete componet and lifestyle. Women love to have beautiful nails, gorgeous shoes and they love to go out. When they go out with their girlfriends they usually have cocktails! Hence The birth of Glam Nails, Heels and Cocktails.

Marsha B.

I myself am a former vegetarian (6 years) but still enjoy cooking vegetable and whole grain loaded foods, in addition to meat, poultry and seafood.

 I also have a huge space perfect for entertaining. Problem is, it's 30 minutes out in Brooklyn. I definitely want to get some dinner party mileage in at my place, but I would imagine at some point other members of the group would offer to host at their places, which may be more convenient for all.

The Big Event of the year that we ALL must go to is the Brooklyn Invitational venue that takes place in Williamsburg area of Brooklyn with the Indian Larry's Bike Shop.

This group will accept and be comprised of all types of Bikes.  Whether you have a Harley, Ducati, Victory, Gxser, Yamaha, Cafe Racer, Chopper or any other type of bike especially something Custom.  All Races, genders, religions will be accepted..   The only Rule..  Safe Riding.. No Stupid shit!.   We'll base out of a huge lot off the Belt Pkwy (Exit 5) behind the Wendy's in the BestBuy parking lot.

<b style="font-size : 16px">From Spring to late fall, on Friday nights, the lot fills with Custom cars, muscle cars, and all types of Bikes.  from like 7pm to 2am..   All levels of experience welcome as well.. 

Name of group comes from DICE Magazine..  Heres the link if youre interested..  

Dice Magazine "Fuck this Lets Ride"

results.description:
Come join us for our weekly NYC Small Business Owners, Consultants & Salespeople meetup.  These meetings promise to be fun, full of energy & productive!

We differentiate ourselves from all other groups by not only introducing ourselves to the group but also by acting as a small business advisory group. Need help with a business problem or issue? We can help. We have been together for over 15 years and are always growing. Come join us.

We believe in fostering entrepreneurship by building communities of startup-minded people through social and business oriented events. NYC Entrepreneurs meets and hosts weekly and monthly events where entrepreneurs connect in a relaxed yet productive way. We meet for breakfast most Thursday mornings in midtown NYC and every THIRD (or fourth) THURSDAY of the month at a local restaurant/bar/pub.

We are going to be meeting for happy hour every month at Ainsworth Park - 6-8PM
111 East 18th Street @Park Ave South (ask for the meetup or Raphi Salem)

We can help you promote your company, services, generate leads and sell your products. We welcome salespeople, entrepreneurs, individual practitioners and representatives of companies large and small. We promote businesses within the group, awareness of each other’s professions, and educate each other to help increase individual success. We grow our business through relationships, networking, and referrals. RSVP here: (Payment of $20.00 must be made in advance of all meetings via paypal here: http://bit.ly/1fDv0KA - or you can pay $25.00 at the door with cash or check. The $500.00 annual membership fee entitles you to exclusive membership with no competition.) 

We have been around since 2000 and have generated millions of dollars in leads and closed business. We are primarily seasoned veterans but welcome young go-getters.

We are similar to many other groups in that we are a roundtable forum and everyone gets to give their :60 second pitch. But then we go deeper into your business in our "advisory" round where we dive into your business issues and act as your own personal advisory board.

We can help you:

- develop a sales plan

- develop a marketing plan

- with finances

- with HR issues

- secure speaking engagements

- become aware of other marketing and sales opportunities, trade shows and advertising mediums

- meet other key people and partners

- get more referrals!

Call Raphi Salem (917-862-8929) today to find out more or to RSVP for any of our monthly events.

Most events take place on Thursday mornings (the 2nd, 3rd and 4th Thursday of every month) at 8-9:30AM. Networking takes place from 8-8:15. The actual meeting and introductions are between 8:15 and 9:30. And then there is more networking after the meeting until 10AM. Once a month we will gather for happy hour at a local bar, tavern, restaurant or lounge.

Cost: Annual Membership is $500. This entitles you to attend all meetings without having to pay the $20 per meeting fee. (Payment must be made in advance via paypal here:

http://bit.ly/1fDv0KA) or to payments {at} salemglobal.com or $25/cash at the door.)

Sponsors: We are always looking for sponsors. Would you like to sponsor our group? Thank you to Paul Berkman of AXA Advisors for helping us secure the conference room for our meetup. He is the best in the business. Come on down to meet him!

Location: AXA Advisors

1290 Avenue of the Americas, 4th Floor

(You must RSVP in order to get on the security list)

We look forward to seeing you at our next Breakfast or other Networking event.

Raphi Salem (917-862-8929)

Please contact me if you have any thoughts, comments, suggestions etc:

Raphi Salem
SalemGlobal Internet
www.SalemGlobal.com
917-862-8929

results.description:
Lady Savant is an Elite Women’s Private Society that brings together dynamic women who are committed to living life fully; that is, physically, mentally and spiritually.  We believe that who you become in 5 years largely depends on who you associate yourself with and we are so proud of the supportive community of trailblazing women we have evolved into!

Our community boasts of women from all walks of life.  From the mom-preneur to the business professional to the stay at home mom; our platform and unique community of “nice girls” creates genuine connections that support the creation and building of close relationships.

Our mission is to create new opportunities whether it is a play date or a new business connection among like minded women who have goals and want to live a “designer life”:  that is, one of your own design!  We believe you should ENVISION your story (and the ending it should have), EXPLORE life with friends, and EVOLVE in to the woman you dare and dream to be.  Find your passion in life. Feel fulfilled. Feel pretty. Feel powerful.  Make a new girlfriend (or five).  The Lady Savant Community is here to help you on your journey.

Our Lady Savants connect and collaborate through private events, an online forum,  and one on one interaction through Savanting Circles (mastermind group). Our members have access to a vast network of women from a multitude of various professions and life experiences. Establishing relationships within this network opens doors and stimulates conversation resulting in the creation of new ideas and close bonds. We are a community that believes in and supports the power of the female spirit.

Are you asking yourself is Lady Savant the right club for you?  If you answer YES to any of the questions below then you are in the right place:

** I want to be inspired to do something more, but I don’t know exactly what?

** I want to make true friendships.

** I need to network and meet other women business owners.

** I don’t work, but I want to learn and explore other options out there.

** I like to volunteer and help others.

** I want to take up a hobby or learn about new trades.

** I like to buy local and support women in following their passions.

** I want to find myself and passions:  spiritually, physically, and mentally.

If you answered YES to any of these questions, Lady Savant is right for you!  Come to our next event (you may attend one event before applying for membership), meet some of the amazing members, and join !  Don’t let another day slip away….this could be the door to your next Chapter in your life.
results.name: Lady Savant: An Elite Women's Society of Bergen County

results.description:
Welcome! We're a group of young women who get together monthly in a small group (10-15 ladies) to discuss a good book and enjoy some wine. We also occassionally have "no reading required" events in addition to regular book club meetings to include more members and try something new! If you're interested in meeting some new friends, please join us!

Fast Facts:

-Meetups are the second Wednesday of each month.

-It's not necessary that you finish the book by the meetup, but be prepared for some spoilers!

-Most of us eat dinner during the meetup, so feel free to come hungry.

-We're really a very fun and friendly group, so if you're on the fence, give us a shot!

Ground Rules:

-Members who don't attend a meetup after RSVP-ing yes and failing to change their RSVP to no will be removed after three such "no-shows."

-Inactive members (not in attendance at any meetups) will be removed after 6 months of inactivity.


2016 Book List

January- Me Before You by Jojo Moyes

February- A Map of the World by Jane Hamilton

March- The Girl on the Train by Paula Hawkins

April- Bel Canto by Ann Patchett

May- The Brief and Wondrous Life of Oscar Wao by Junot Diaz

June- We Were Liars by E. Lockhart

July- I'll Give You the Sun by Jandy Nelson

August- Pretty Girls- Karen Slaughter

September- Infinite Home by Kathleen Alcott

October- In a Dark, Dark Wood- Ruth Ware Kitchens of the Great Midwest- J. Ryan Stradal

November- Kitchens of the Great Midwest- J. Ryan Stradal

December- Moriarty by Anthony Horowitz

POLICY 

Need ID.

Bring your own things

results.description:
Profitable Teaching is a tight network of support for teaching individuals and startups – a new wave of entrepreneurs creating great content, and growing their own online courses to change the world (and make some money along the way too). 

This event series is a joint venture between:
- A select group of teaching startups who've grown their own audiences and are looking to better engage and monetize their audience with online courses in New York City.
- Fedora, the platform that allows anyone to launch their own online courses.
- A braintrust of new teacher entrepreneurs, getting started with their own part-time or full-time online education businesses.

Our content will center around:
1. Turning your experience into GREAT content.
2. Growing an online audience, even if you don't have experience.
3. Making change (as in cash money) with online courses.

This meetup will foster a physical place where we can put down our laptops and get to know each other over drinks in New York City. If you're interested in contributing or sponsoring a future event, feel free to message one of the organizers.

If you're just getting started with teaching online, check out this free course for more: Profitable Course Idea

We’re also excited to host various events, including exclusive networking mixers, write-ins and readings, open-mic and spoken word nights, workshops and seminars, and much more. Also currently in development is an interactive site for members engage with one another. Some of the awesome features will include: 

- A directory of all members, including contact information, specialties, and writing samples, accessible only to other members. All in your city, all at your fingertips.

results.description:
Welcome! I'm Tony. I created this Group on February 20th, 2014! This is The "ORIGINAL" group for Desis who are " Divorced, Separated, Widowed, Desis of NJ, PA, CT,& NY With or Without Kids! :) "

I just appointed Khurram Chaudhry as my Co-organizer December 15th, 2015! :)

To be a member of this group:

*****You must Be of Desi/Indian Decent or mixed Indian Decent to join this Group*****

I am Tony and I have 100% Sole Custody of my daughter! I know the challenges of being a single parent! 

Please Join us to build Deep, Authentic, and Rich Friendships that leave you feeling Breathless knowing others have been or are in the same boat as you. You don't have to be alone! We are here for you because "You Matter" "You Are Special" and "You Deserve to be Happy Again"

If you know of a location you would like to have an event, please send me all the details and I will take the ease of having you post it and will try post it for you if it's a location that will work for the group. I will list you as the contact person and members will contact you at the venue when they arrive if I cannot make it. Simply introduce yourself in a professional manner to the arriving members and take multiple group pics and send them to me so I can post them. Seamless, why go thru the hassle of posting an event when it can be done for you. Just give me 1 or 1 1/2 weeks notice beforehand to make sure there are no conflicts. 

I have a Fantastic Real-time Whatsapp group as well. If you you have attended an event and would like to be considered to join it please call 856.562.8087 and I will send you the rules to agree to in ordered to be considered for the chat. This comes with rules. Some folks in the world consider having rules as  "Policing People" and want to have "Total freedom from Rules" and respect for one another, but I consider having Rules is imperative in all aspects of life. Think of it like a corporate environment you respect your coworkers  etc.. or when having rules for your children, or when parents raised you with Morals, Values and Rules to respect our elders, our parents and each other. Rules exist everywhere in society in way that try keeps everyone respectful to one another. I believe in the same. My rules are don't harass members, don't discuss or post sexual/porn topics/pics, don't use cuss words, be respectful of all members in the chat and group, don't discuss religion/politics in chat and don't discriminate against those who are gays or lesbians. For the full list of rules please reach out to me. Being Loving and Respectful is the best way to be! I leave you with this thought - Is it really a bad thing to ask each other to respect one another? We all know the answer to this.....It's not Policing, it's common courtesy and respect which we all deserve. Have a great rest of the weekend all :)

Please check the members section as often as you can because I do not allow Ex husbands or Ex Wives of Existing members to join. If you see he or she is a member, please let me know and show me the proof it was an ex and I will remove the member. Whoever of the 2 exes joins, the 1st gets to stay in the group. You must let me know as that is the only way I will know.

Most people who attend events are repeat attendees. The Reviews speak for themselves! Quality control is #1 in the group to make sure all members are comfortable, aren't being harrassed and reached out to by members who they haven't event met to circumvent the designed "Meetup process."

Please Keep in mind I don't promote this as a singles group but more of a support group. However, if you meet someone special along the way from attending events, I would love to hear the feedback as this has happened once already! :)

***Please include a face picture when you join, it must be a clear, close up, in color pic without sunglasses***  

                                                               " Your Friendly Organizer :)"  TONY

results.description:
Welcome to Brighton Beach Wing Chun Academy!

Wing Chun is one of the best self defense martial arts in the world. It is known for it's efficiency and effectiveness. Wing Chun is not a competitive sport, as it's principles are geared entirely for combat. Please come on in and try this wonderful martial art for yourself! New Members get 2 week Free Trial! 

Our address is: 330 Neptune Ave. Brooklyn, NY 11235

We meet every Tuesday and Thursday at 7 PM - 9 PM.  

Saturday classes are from 12:30 PM -  2:30 PM.

The classes are $120 per month.

Please checkout our past Meetup pictures, or take a look and like our Facebook page!

Foundation of Wing Chun:

According to Grand Master Yip Man, Wing Chun was developed by Ng Mui, who was Abbess at the Henan Shaolin Monastery and managed to survive its destruction by Qing forces during the reign of the Kangxi Emperor (1662–1722). She fled to the White Crane Temple (somewhere in the Daliang mountains between Yunnan and Sichuan), where she met a girl of fifteen named Yim Wing-Chun whom a bandit was trying to force into marriage. Ng Mui taught Wing-Chun how to defend herself by distilling Shaolin martial art knowledge into a system that Wing-Chun could learn quickly and use without developing great strength.

To see what Wing Chun Kung Fu actually looks like in action, please do a YouTube search for IP Man.
results.name: Brighton Beach Wing Chun Kung Fu Meetup, NYC

results.description:
What is "The Italian Boot Camp" and what will it do for you?

It's a series of educational meetings (beginner, intermediate, advanced) where English speaking New Yorkers just like you, will be guided and helped to achieve mastery in the Italian language, as fast as humanly possible.


Tentative Schedule(*)

Lesson 1: 

Nouns: gender and number 

Definite and indefinite articles 


Lesson 2:
Adjectives; possessive and demonstrative pronouns 

The present tense of essere and avere 


Lesson 3:
The present tense of regular (and some irregular) verbs 

Adverbs 


Lesson 4:

Direct object pronouns 

Prepositions 


Lesson 5:
Questions Indirect object pronouns 

Week 6:

Piacere and similar verbs 

The present perfect tense 


Lesson 7:

Direct and indirect object pronouns 

Direct and indirect object pronouns (3: stressed forms) 


Lesson 8:

Relative pronouns 

The imperfect tense 


Lesson 9:

The pronouns ne and ci 

The future tense 


Lesson 10:

The past perfect tense

Reflexive pronouns 


Lesson 11:

The imperative

The pronoun si 


Lesson 12:

The present conditional



See you soon!

Gaetano


(*) The specific level (beginner, intermediate, advanced) may be specified in each meetup page, as needed.
results.name: The Italian Boot Camp

results.description:
This is a group for women interested in being healthy and fit for the summer months.

It is beginning this Sunday 03/02 and continues through Sunday 04/20. It will run for 7 wks. Each week, I will schedule a meetup on that Sunday to celebrate our achievements. It will either be at Bottagra in Hawthorne or Kafe Neo in Totowa. If you can’t make the event on Sunday, you can still participate.

If you RSVP “YES” for the event, then you are signing up to be Fit that week and that week only. It’s a confirmation you are making saying “Yes I will try to live healthier and loose weight.”

Once you RSVP yes, you will then be required to post in advance by day (Sun-Sat) in the comments section of the event:

1) Your meal plan (Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner, and a snack) 2) Your planned 30-40 minute exercise for that day. Studies show:

1) Small steps are best when trying to change your life so let’s do it week by week. 2) If you plan your meals in advance you are more likely to stick with the plan. 3) If you schedule time for exercise then you are more likely to stick with it. 4) If you have a group of people with the same goal doing the same thing then you are more likely to stay with it. 5) If you give yourself a moment to celebrate what you accomplished instead of wishing away your failures, you are more likely to be successful.

After posting, no one is to comment negatively on anyone else’s post. Or, you will be thrown out of the group.

I am RSVP’ing so look for my plan in the comments tonight. It will also work as example of what you are suppose to do once you say “YES.”

Love to All..Good Luck…And I hope you join.

Michele
results.name: Weekly Fit & Fun Group "You are Invited" (WOMEN ONLY)

results.description: Why should people pay $10-$20 for one watered down, iced up drink in New York City? I've looked all over NYC for the perfect cheap Open bar spot. I found a few but one stood out the most. $20-$25 open bar, UNLIMITED: Sangria, Vodka & Orange juice, Cranberry & vodka. Selter & Vodka, Selter & Gin, ginger ale & vodka, Ginger ale & Tequila, Coke & Whiskey, Diet Pepsi & Tequila, pineapple & vodka, pineapple & rum. Unlimited SHOTS (Rum, Tequila, Whiskey, Vodka). This spot also has some amazing liquor milkshakes and liquor smoothies. I tried this one liquor milkshake that had: "Kalua, cast & cream, rum, Oreo cookies, vanilla cookies, chocolate & vanilla ice cream" wow that drink was amazing. There was one that was a liquor fruit smoothie and they had an awesome Tequila margarita cocktail. They have Karaoke on two big screens, Nintendo games & 250 free arcade video games from the 80s. Did i forget to mention they have amazing burgers, beer, onion rings, tots and many other cool foods. This group is for: drinkers who want to bar crawl to different spots and drink for cheap, Karaoke singers, video games players, network socializers, meet new people, singles, movie night watchers and people who love food/burgers. Every week we will try something different. One week Karaoke night, one week movie night, card games/board games, all while experiencing amazing drinks and open bars. I will also find the best happy hours for beer, food and other drinks. If enough members RSVPs and shows up to meet ups, I will talk with the owners of different bars to get better deals on open bars & happy hours. Join this group, lets socialize, network, drink for cheap, have fun and meet new people.

results.description:
Hi Everyone!  Welcome.

My vision for this group = "grown-up gym class" for anyone 26 and older.

Purpose:  To get together at least once/week for a pick-up game involving a different activity each time, with the emphasis on making fitness fun - basically, to get outside and play! Activities that come to mind, or have been mentioned - ultimate frisbee, touch football, paintball, basketball, hiking, soccer, scavenger hunt, volleyball, kickball, paddleboarding - all tbd based on group interest, always open to suggestions.

You do not need to be from North Jersey, but I live in the Montclair area, so field/court activities will be in one of the parks within a reasonable distance (approx 20-30 min = from Bloomfield to Morristown etc).  There will be other activities (kayaking, paddleboarding) that may require further travel.

The first rule of Fit Club = talk about Fit Club - the more the merrier

Please note:  this is an activities based fitness group, all fitness levels are welcome, but please know your own personal limitations based on the activity for that day.  Joining this group is done so on a voluntary basis, and by doing so, you accept all responsibility for your actions, including any injuries that may occur. 

Update 6/1/15:  There is now a one-time $5 (or $6) fee to join NJFC.  Please read the NJFC document under the "More" tab, then "files."  And, please bear with me during the transition - this process kicked off approx 500+ members (mostly inactive) but it will take some time to rebuild in order to get big group activities planned again.

Thank you.

Holly
results.name: North Jersey Fit Club

By incorporating a team approach, and believing that collectively we are able to benefit from the wisdom and experience of all men in the room, we help each other to be the best dads we can possibly be.

"I had lost touch with my daughters for fifteen years. I now have them back in my life in the most powerful way I could have imagined"
"The dads in the room are great core individuals with the intelligence and experience to successfully lead with powerful, magnanimous and pioneering vision and deliver practical results"
We invite you to contact us to join in on this wonderful journey ahead of us.
For more information, contact David Turk at: dave@fatheringforum.org

This is a group for martial artists of sound mind and good character who would like to occasionally meet up and spar with others from various styles to test and refine their skills in an energetic, supportive, sportsmanlike environment. This group is for men and women 18 and older of all fighting styles with at least 1 year of formal martial arts training under a qualified instructor.

This is NOT a class, training course, fitness group, or seminar. We do not meet to "cross-train" or swap techniques. This is NOT a "fight club". Brawling and showing lack of reasonable control/restraint will not be tolerated. Maintaining the right group culture is essential. 

You must officially register before you can participate in sparring.  Register by joining www.SparringClub.com.

Sessions will be respectful ("friendly") but also combative, meaning you should expect your partner to actively engage you. We use light or medium contact (holding back power, showing restraint when partner takes hard blow, certain kinds of strikes prohibited). Mandatory protective gear and rules are set and collectively enforced. You must be willing to sign a waiver accepting full liability for injury and sole responsibility for your own protection and safety. <br>

Spread the Word!  Like Us on FACEBOOK

Click here to go to our DC/Maryland Meetup Group

results.description:
This is a development-centric meetup group for mobile .NET development with a primary focus on Xamarin.  We welcome all skill levels as well as those with no experience at all.  Anyone interested in joining a vibrant community and deeply understanding the Xamarin platform is a great fit.  We will engage in actual development projects, with the entire team focusing on a particular problem, architecting and developing in tandem, and then comparing results with the team as a whole.  We will use best-in-class development tools such as: Xamarin Studio, GitHub, XCode, Visual Studio, SQLite, Amazon Cloud, Cassandra/HBase NoSQL, AngularJS, Node.js, etc.  The huge upside is that while we develop on the core technologies, we'll also be building up our skillset with highly effective and marketable ancillary technologies. 

The format of the group will be as follows: 

We'll meet as an entire group and define what we'd like to build in the upcoming sprint (we might as well use Agile terms).  The project definitions will be fairly narrow, especially in the early phases of the group while we're developing our nascent skills. So for example, we may say, "This week we'll build the map screen for a simple mapping application that supports push-pins, on iOS".  

We'll then break the group into teams of 2, attempting to balance out our experience and talent levels as well as possible.   After that point, we'll all go away and dive into the code.  Each group of two will work on the project for the duration of the sprint. We'll create an environment of open collaboration by way of an online project management tool.  

The following meetup will then serve as a code review where we will conduct the following exercises as a group: 

1) Compare architectural decisions and defend reasons for making those decisions

2) Discuss extensions and other third-party components used to aid development

3) Discuss your greatest pain points, or where you flat out hit a brick wall

4) Attempt to gain consensus on the best methods of accomplishing each of the tasks, and compile those methods into a best-practices reference

5) Merge our best code into a common area, and promote that version as group-certified (it's probably very ambitious to try to accomplish this during an actual Meetup)

Then we'll define the next project, and re-start the development cycle.  We can either completely start over with an altogether different project, or build new components onto the existing one, gradually working our way towards an enterprise-worthy app.  

One great thing about these short development sprints is that we can always bring on new developers at any one of our Meetups.
results.name: NJ Mobile .NET Developers

Mission:

Women Who Code is a global nonprofit organization dedicated to inspiring women to excel in technology careers by creating a global, connected community of women in technology. The organization tripled in 2013 and has grown to be one of the largest communities of women engineers in the world.

Empowerment:

Women Who code is a professional community for women in tech. We provide an avenue for women to pursue a career in technology, help them gain new skills and hone existing skills for professional advancement, and foster environments where networking and mentorship are valued.

Key Initiatives:

Free technical study groups

Events featuring influential tech industry experts and investors

Hack events

Career and leadership development

Current and aspiring coders are welcome. 

Bring your laptop and a friend! 

Support Women Who Code:

Donating to Women Who Code, Inc. (#46-4218859) directly impacts our ability to efficiently run this growing organization, helps us produce new programs that will increase our reach, and enables us to expand into new cities around the world ensuring that women and girls everywhere have the opportunity to pursue a career in technology.

Women Who Code (WWCode) is dedicated to providing an empowering experience for everyone who participates in or supports our community, regardless of gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, ability, physical appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion, or socioeconomic status. Because we value the safety and security of our members and strive to have an inclusive community, we do not tolerate harassment of members or event participants in any form. Our Code of Conduct applies to all events run by Women Who Code, Inc. If you would like to report an incident or contact our leadership team, please submit an incident report form.

results.description:
In 1826 Josiah Holbrook organized the Millbury Branch Number 1 of the American Lyceum with the goal of bringing lifelong education through presentation and spirited debate to everyone. Mr. Holbrook’s great hope was to bring about a general and universal diffusion of knowledge regardless of age, gender or station. Taking the name “Lyceum” from Aristotle’s school, Mr. Holbrook’s efforts resulted in the organization of thousands of local Lyceums and the brief formation of a National Lyceum.

At Axial, we agree strongly with Mr. Holbrook that education is a lifelong exercise. We believe that curiosity and ingenuity are critically important and that you should engage in debate with friends, colleagues and experts on a variety of topics frequently and vigorously.

In the spirit of the 19th century Lyceum movement, we invite domain experts to our offices every month to give a presentation or participate in a panel discussion. Our doors are open to anyone interested in joining the debate (and of course, there’s always the free Sixpoint). 

The Axial Corps of Engineers is a team of technologists dedicated to pragmatically and predictably shipping innovative software. Some people would say we’re flip-floppers, but we reserve the right to change our minds when new evidence is presented. The best argument, implementation or design on any given day is the one we’ll favor at Axial, not the one coming from the person with the highest rank, title or most pull. We value practical consideration and self-restraint backed by solid communication over rockstars, samurais and ninjas.

We’ll use a framework, tool, language or approach as soon as it becomes obvious that it’s well supported, stable, low maintenance and the right tool for the job.

*We kindly ask that agency recruiters refrain from attending.

**If you feel like you have a relevant talk that you'd like to present, send some information over to alex.steinberg@axial.net.
results.name: Axial Lyceum

results.description: Most writing experiences, whether it is for school or a creative piece, can go through a writer´s block stage.  Sometimes being in community while writing, breaks this spell! Putting thoughts into paper can be an isolating one that can be contradicted sharing it with others alike. I am about to create a space of safety, solace, inspiration and accompaniment to helps us plaster our words unto the page or screen! So that we can move forward and fulfill our calling or timelines.  If you are one of those who gets energy while writing in cafes and libraries, or people places, this may be for you. I invite you to try it!

results.description: This is a group for misfits. Misfits of all kinds. It's called unusual because it refers to a special kind of misfit, where you are not necessarily a misfit in all aspects of your life, but one or more of them and you feel really unusual, awkward or inexplicable about why you were not able to fit in. For example, it could be at work, in your family, or in your dating life with same/opposite sex, or your surrounding society. These are the people who are waiting to fit into those areas that they always had trouble fitting in, but wanted to fit in. I understand that the name 'misfits' is used in television/movie titles, but I have never watched any of them. So, just to be clear, this group is not an imitation or is not inspired by any sort of fiction. We can discuss our issues as to why we are not able to fit in those certain areas of life - probably come up with a solution or just laugh it off and move on. Either way, you know that there's a group of people out there that feel something similar to what you feel.
results.name: Unusual Misfits

results.description:

Looking forward to meeting you! 

Aurore

results.description:
This Meetup will provide a safe space to begin the journey in understanding the justice system, both civil and criminal, and supporting one another in our effort to achieve equality in society using these systems.

The meetings will explore the issues related to intersectionality, including race, gender and class, access to justice, the impact of these issues on our personhood and humanity, and seek to develop a network of competent, qualified and committed legal professional to help when the need arises.

We will share our stories and learn what others have done or are doing when faced with various legal issues related to running a business, owning and managing property, obtaining access to justice to ensure equal pay, redress for violent acts committed against us or family members, and generally ensuring access to justice.

The mission is to build both a political action committee to monitor and comment on justice issues that impact our community and to form a non-profit organization to fund litigation, conduct research, and educate the community on critical social justice issues. We also seek to develop a prison to aid those who might not otherwise have support outside of the prison system.

In a Nutshell – this is a place to never feel awkward or alone. Note that while the focus of the group is on African American women, any woman who has an issue with the legal system or wishes to offer support is welcome to attend and participate.

The Mission: Arm ourselves for the "battle" ahead by providing an environment driven by caring and sharing, pooling our resources & knowledge and taking advantage of our strength in numbers to better assist one another.
results.name: Justice Speakers

results.description:
This is the meet up group for Hekates Sacred Temple-Torchbearer of the Crossroads.  This is a place for anyone whether or not they already belong to a Coven, Group or Solitary to come together as Devotees of Hekate to worship Her in a safe environment. To make this  Temple a strong member of the NY Pagan Community.

We have been sanctioned by New York State as a Non-Profit Religious Organization with all the rights and privileges that a legal non-profit in the state has.  By the law only non profit religious organizations are authorized to hold public services  

Hekate’s Sacred Temple-Torchbearer of the Crossroads Mission Statement:

We are a Hekatean Wiccan/ Pagan Coven whose Matron Goddess is Hekate. We honor Her in all of our rites and rituals and we also honor  Deities that are associated with Hekate. Though we are Pagan we believe and follow some Wiccan Principles, they are the following:The Wiccan Rede, the Rule of Three and the Thirteen Principles of Witchcraft. To promote the practice and understanding of Pagan, Wiccan and all  Earth-centered traditions.  To welcome all   Pagans and those  who do not consider themselves Pagans. We also welcome Pagans and inquirers who are not members of Hekate's Sacred Temple but who will act in accordance with our principles. To hold regular rituals. We celebrate the Dark/New Moon, all Eight Sabats on The Wheel of the Year as we as all of Hekate's Festival Days.
 To explore and celebrate in a safe and supportive environment the teachings and wisdom of Hekate and Pagan/Wiccan traditions.  To share, teach, learn, and explore by modeling, by mentoring, by demonstration, by oral and written traditions, and by workshops and classes. To affirm each other as we each follow our own individual spiritual path through this life. We maintain an environment that is safe, physically, emotionally, and spiritually. We respect boundaries and comfort levels of self and others. 

Our Board of Trustees are:

Rev. Alexandra Morrigan Raven - High Priestess of Hekate

Lady Morgana of Avallone - High Priestess of Hekate

Michael Houze - High Priest

If you would like to know about any of the above, please go to the Temple's website:

www.hekatesacredtemple.org
results.name: Hekates Sacred Temple-Torchbearer of The Crossroads

For each event, the organizer will talk about the architecture, history, and sculpture in an area, but you will have plenty of time to socialize with others in the group and enjoy the scenery. These are sociable walks that go through historic neighborhoods, along scenic waterfronts, in public parks, and to artist studios, historic houses, festivals, and so on.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The cost of each event is $2 per person, which is paid at the start of the walk. This is for the organizer's Meetup preparation costs and fees.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

If you have any questions for one of the organizers, you can contact that organizer through her/his private Meetup inbox. The organizer for the event is listed on the top of the "going list" with a photograph.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

If you are registered for a walk and can't attend, please change your RSVP online from "YES" to "NO". This might allow someone else to go. There is no need to post why you can't make the event.

A member who incurs an excessive number of no-shows will be removed from this group and not be allowed to attend events. Thank you for your cooperation. 

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Please go in the Pages Tab and read the liability waiver. Thank you again.

We work hard and sometimes we forget about having fun to provide balance. 30s & 40s Thinking Professionals Fun Circle love to experience fun new adventures, volunteering, going dancing or trying different restaurants. We see movies, play at game nights and celebrate any event we can think of. We also like to kick back with a beer (or whiskey) and some good conversation or relax and chat over coffee. The Arowana Dragon Boat paddling team is a New York City-based recreational team looking for new teammates to share in the experience of Dragon Boat and have a great time! Our goals are to train for the New York HK Dragon Boat Festival Race in Flushing mid-August and for out-of-state races throughout the year. We welcome all experience levels and offer practices on Saturdays and Sundays. We sometimes head  to lunch afterwards. Arowana Dragon Boat team was formed in 2009 by a group of friends to promote the sport of dragon boat, to build a strong sense of community, and to compete at the highest level possible. We are Arowana!

results.description:
Have you ever noticed that most of the local networking meetups take place in NYC? We know it can be difficult traveling into the city for some of these events so we decided to create the No Pressure Networking meetup for professionals who want to expand their network and create new business opportunities. We truly believe that great networking is built on a solid connection and not on exchanging a business card. As a business development manager and having been to many networking events myself, I noticed how tense and awkward it could be for many people. 

We want to bring together a diverse mix of professionals from various industries and career levels in a relaxing, pressure-free atmosphere. Our end-goal is to build powerful, meaningful, and collaborative relationships without all the stress of “business networking”. So sign up, come out, and lets have a drink!
results.name: North Jersey No Pressure Networking

results.description:
Welcome! Have you recently moved to the area, gotten married, had a new baby, or are just interested in getting to know others in your community? Scotch Plains-Fanwood Newcomers and Neighbors, with approximately 80 active families, offers daytime and evening social activities just for you. During the year, members organize activities for a variety of interest groups and plan special events. They occur days, evenings, and weekends so there is something for everyone. 

Please visit our website for more information www.spfnewcomers.com.

Our annual membership dues are $35 per family.


How to join our group:

• Click on the Join Us! link on this page to submit a request to join Meetup.  

• You will begin a 14 day free trial of the Meetup group. You will also receive an email with further instructions on becoming a full member which includes completing a membership form and paying annual membership dues of $35.

• Once your additional information has been received and dues have been paid you'll receive a welcome email, usually within one week. We look forward to seeing you at an event soon!
results.name: Scotch Plains-Fanwood Newcomers

results.description:
If you've longed to attend social events where the participants are "very"  girly and very femme  looking, this is the meet up group for you.  If you're in a relationship and you're both very femme looking, please join us! 

This group is specifically for the girly, feminine, lipstick, heels, dress wearing lesbian femme and  girly Bi femme who  "are" dating  or want to date a femme as equally dolled up and frilly as herself.  We do exist  and it's time we cultivate our own community  of  "femme for Femme" , The venues & details of our meet ups are announced to members only.

This is a closed group so your photos will be seen only by members in our group.  

Calling all single, career professional, "classy",  " ladies" to post your photos and bio. Suggest events and activities for us to enjoy. 

Girly femmes from the 5 boroughs of New York City, long Island and the tri-State area all welcomed! 


Single femmes & Ladies in femme to femme relationships are welcome to enjoy our monthly Sunday brunch & monthly girl talk meet ups.


Reasons for members being removed  from this group include but are not limited to :  

1.  Unpaid member dues

2. Behaviors  adversely affecting  group morale.

3. Profiles without a photo of your face.

4. Photos that do not represent what you look like ( eg, pets, food, flowers)


Please disregard the meetup default setting that says dues are optional. This is a community supported group, all of our members pay monthly dues.

Membership dues: only $2 each month. Payment is made online. 

Please make first payment at the time you join the group. "No refund" policy for member dues.  


Please do invite your girly Bi and  girly Lesbian friends to join you at our meet ups 

To  RSVP  for our events, members must be current in late- unpaid  membership dues. 

The venue details of our meet ups is for members only. 


Join Us!

Sunshine

Organizer

results.description:
Over the next three months we will be meeting with residents, artists, and community leaders to use photography to document our community for an online and 63rd drive underpass exhibition. We will also be asking individuals to lend their voices to a larger underpass movement where they will document underpasses in NYC and put them on Instagram. As our voices grow, attention to the issue will grow. Together we will change underpasses that run through the hubs of our communities.

You can get involved in a number of ways.

1. Join our meet-up group and come to an event

2.Rate your Underpass. By letting us know which underpasses in the community you aren't happy with.  If we have enough voices behind a particular underpass we can take the Underpass Art Movement to more locations

Information on how to rate  your underpass can be found here. (It's Easy) http://www.regoparkgreenalliance.org/#!rete-my-underpass/c10fc

3. Like our new Facebook page Underpass Art Movement

https://www.facebook.com/pages/Underpass-Art-Movement-NYC/643844632353049

4. Tell and share the Underpass Art Movement with your friends, family and colleagues.

The Underpass Art Movement is hosted by Rego Park Green Alliance. You can see some of the other project we are involved with by visiting our website.

http://www.regoparkgreenalliance.org/
results.name: Underpass Art Movement

results.description:
Mission:

Women Who Code is a global nonprofit organization dedicated to inspiring women to excel in technology careers by creating a global, connected community of women in technology. The organization tripled in 2013 and has grown to be one of the largest communities of women engineers in the world.

Empowerment:

Women Who code is a professional community for women in tech. We provide an avenue for women to pursue a career in technology, help them gain new skills and hone existing skills for professional advancement, and foster environments where networking and mentorship are valued.

Key Initiatives:

Free technical study groups

Events featuring influential tech industry experts and investors

Hack events

Career and leadership development

Current and aspiring coders are welcome. 

Bring your laptop and a friend! 

Support Women Who Code:

Donating to Women Who Code, Inc. (#46-4218859) directly impacts our ability to efficiently run this growing organization, helps us produce new programs that will increase our reach, and enables us to expand into new cities around the world ensuring that women and girls everywhere have the opportunity to pursue a career in technology.

Women Who Code (WWCode) is dedicated to providing an empowering experience for everyone who participates in or supports our community, regardless of gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, ability, physical appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion, or socioeconomic status. Because we value the safety and security of our members and strive to have an inclusive community, we do not tolerate harassment of members or event participants in any form. Our Code of Conduct applies to all events run by Women Who Code, Inc. If you would like to report an incident or contact our leadership team, please submit an incident report form.

WomenWhoCode.com

Twitter | Facebook
results.name: Women Who Code NYC

results.description:
The New York City Enterprise Collaboration Meetup Group is dedicated to providing enterprise technologists, business people, analysts, and curiosity seekers thought leading information around Enterprise Collaboration. We focus on how business tools such as Yammer, Office 365, and Azure that are currently impacting the key issues corporations face:

• The bottom line

• User experience

• Minimal technical debt

• Compliance

Our presenters are the tech workers in the trenches deploying these solutions to the masses.

No sales pitches, little PowerPoint, just raw enterprise technology.

This meetup is ideal for the tech manager who actually manages the technology and wants the real scoop of the product.


Where tech reality meets the bottom line


Event sponsors: 

Soho Dragon-

SharePoint.  That is all we do.

We do more than just install SharePoint; we focus on the real issues like usability, adoption, content management, business process improvement, and security.  

After all, what good is a shiny new team site if people still email content around with version numbers in the filename?  That’s why we don’t just do the SharePoint plumbing; we also specialize in training, adoption and implementation strategy.


Cloud Strategies

You bring information technology into your company to help your people be more productive.  Sometimes, however, it feels like you spend more time focused on the technology than on growing your business.

CloudStrategies' goal is to make computing as easy and accessible as telephone or electrical service.  Plug and play.  With our cloud solutions, the same is true for your computers and devices.  Plug into the internet and gain immediate access to all the resources you need to get the job done.

You focus on your core business.  Let CloudStrategies and Microsoft focus on your email and collaboration…business-relevant solutions that your people need wherever, whenever and on whatever device they may be using.
results.name: New York City Enterprise Collaboration Meetup

results.description:
Like us on Facebook! 

You've done your homework. Your instrument is at its peak. You know the part, the lines, the emotion and the motivation. But do you feel you are you worthy of the part? Of course you are, however sometimes you might show up for the audition with a bit of doubt (fear? anxiety?) and telegraph that feeling to the casting director.

You wish you only thought about the best things that you offer, but you just aren't sure if you have what it takes; what they want; or even if you are worthy. Gene Hirschel, a master in the field of behavior consulting and shaping, will show you specialized techniques that break though your existing mental limitations. Gene doesn't just tell you how to effect these changes; he actually uses the most advanced behavior technologies to install new behaviors directly into your mind and body.

Gene Hirschel has been on TV, radio and taught at the School of Visual Arts as well as many top corporations. For the first time, he brings his amazing techniques to the acting community so you too can master this crucial step in stage and screen success -- and get the part!

Imagine after this seminar:

•Easily identify and connecting to the decision maker(s) at the audition

•Learning to gain a deep rapport with almost anyone!

 •Become an expert at automatically calling in confidence and using it. •Entering a room expecting the very best performance from yourself and then-- experiencing exactly that!

•Clearly picture and know in your heart that you are absolutely worthy and deserving of the part

•Learn how to "pre-charge" the room with positive outcome energy.

•Mentally re-map previous auditions in your past to create an unstoppable “audition machine”
results.name: Audition Mastery for NYC Actors - Are you audition worthy?

results.description:
We believe in fostering entrepreneurship by building communities of startup-minded people through social and business oriented events. NYC Entrepreneurs meets and hosts weekly and monthly events where entrepreneurs connect in a relaxed yet productive way. We meet for breakfast most Thursday mornings in midtown NYC and every THIRD (or fourth) THURSDAY of the month at a local restaurant/bar/pub.

We are going to be meeting for happy hour every month at Ainsworth Park - 6-8PM
111 East 18th Street @Park Ave South (ask for the meetup or Raphi Salem)

We can help you promote your company, services, generate leads and sell your products. We welcome  entrepreneurs, individual practitioners, salespeople and representatives of companies large and small. We promote businesses within the group, awareness of each others professions, and educate each other to help increase individual success. We grow our business through relationships, networking, and referrals. RSVP here: (Payment of $20.00 must be made in advance of all meetings via paypal here: http://bit.ly/1fDv0KA - or you can pay $25.00 at the door with cash or check. The $500.00 annual membership fee entitles you to exclusive membership with no competition.)

We have been around since 2000 and have generated millions of dollars in leads and closed business. We are primarily seasoned veterans but welcome young go-getters.

We are similar to many other groups in that we are a roundtable forum and everyone gets to give their :60 second pitch. But then we go deeper into your business in our "advisory" round where we dive into your business issues and act as your own personal advisory board.

We can help you:

- develop a sales plan

- develop a marketing plan

- with finances

- with HR issues

- secure speaking engagements

- become aware of other marketing and sales opportunities, trade shows and advertising mediums

- meet other key people and partners

- get more referrals!

Call Raphi Salem (917-862-8929) today to find out more or to RSVP for any of our monthly events.

Most events take place on Thursday mornings (the 2nd, 3rd and 4th Thursday of every month) at 8-9:30AM.  Then there is more networking after the meeting until 10AM.

Cost: Annual Membership is $500. This entitles you to attend all meetings without having to pay the $20 per meeting fee. (Payment must be made in advance via paypal here:http://bit.ly/1fDv0KA) or to payments {at} salemglobal.com or $25/cash at the door.)

Sponsors: We are always looking for sponsors. Would you like to sponsor our group? Thank you to Paul Berkman of AXA Advisors for helping us secure the conference room for our meetup. He is the best in the business. Come on down to meet him!

Location: AXA Advisors 1290 Avenue of the Americas, 16th Floor

(You must RSVP in order to get on the security list)

We look forward to seeing you at our next Breakfast or other Networking event.

We are part of 5 other meetup groups. Please check them out and join:

results.description: This is a group for anyone passionate about Apple's Mac computer, technology reuse, and the burgeoning circular economy critical to our survival as a species. Planned obsolescence has never been more abundant in our society. This anti-consumer group examines the evolution of the Mac, and scrutinizes Apple's built in obsolescence strategies (how many new cables have you been forced to buy when upgrading?) You don't need to be an uber-geek to attend. All are welcome! I started this group because after nearly 20 years of working with Apple, I'm eager to share knowledge and discuss these topics. Looking forward to exploring these ideas and much more with everybody! Some group highlights: - Is Apple downgrading the Mac? - Innovative reuse and DIY - Sustainable product design

results.description:
This is a group for people who are looking for understanding (open minded) individuals to talk to. If you need to vent out and talk to someone or a group, then this is the place where you'll be heard. The members take an active role in acting as counselors and provide positive feedback and help guide members to taking steps to do better. We are all about being positive here for positive outcomes, so if your intention is to stay sad rather than progress then this is not the place for you. I started this group because when i was going through a very difficult time, i had no one to talk to, vent out or tell me that things were going to be OK. I suffered a great deal having to resolve many of these issues on my own, having to push myself out of depression was not easy. This group is made so that you don't have to go through the same thing and have someone who will listen. This group does not consist of therapist, social workers, or any type of mental health workers. just normal open minded people, willing to share their stories, listen to yours, and try our best to end things on a positive note.

You could be having a bad day or going through a rough period of time, if you need to vent out, this is a good place to try.
results.name: I need someone to talk to.

“This is a bilingual group (English/Spanish) for anyone interested in improving their photography skills. The organizer will offer from time to time workshops in specific topics such as: The histograph, inverse square law, basic posing, depht of field, exposure triangle, flash photograhy, etc. 

This group will also meet in public places for practicing what we love, photography. When we meet, the members of the group will be given a specif task for that day. The idea here is to improve our skills step by step. The goal of the group is to learn from one another and to help each other during the shoots. 

To achieve the goal, the members of the group will be encouraged to socialize and to form small teams. Each team will have a task: One team, for example, can concentrate in depth of field and the other one can concentrate in composition. 

Each team will also have a leader. The leader will supervise and give instructions to the team on how to achieve the goal. 

 All skills levels are welcome. 

Let's make this work for us. Let's give each others a hand and at the same time learn from each other.

Tino

http://tinophotovideo.com

topics.name: Health and Wellness Information and Education

results.description:
Welcome to our new Community! 

Do you feel overwhelmed with trying to make healthy changes for you and your family?
Do you need that extra push to start eating healthy?

 If you are in need of motivation and support, join us and discover a unique approach to living your best life. We will provide you with the tools you need to make lasting changes in your life. 

I hope to be able to bring health and wellness to the forefront of people's lives.  If you are already a "health-guru" or you are just beginning your journey, this is a place to connect with people who are on that same path.  

This is about unearthing the skills you already possess and gaining the confidence to live your life to its fullest capacity. Our mantra is bio-individuality; that each person has unique food and lifestyle needs. 

Come and join us in an environment that is non-judgmental, warm and welcoming.  We will have lots of great workshops to encourage you, guide you and inspire you to integrate healthy habits into your lifestyle.  Join us as we begin our journey of transformation together!
results.name: Lifestyle Changes: A Journey of Transformation

results.description:
Join us to follow CLASSICAL4ALL events; concerts, interdisciplinary projects, music appreciation classes.

Our mission is to create new ways for presenting classical music, without altering the musical content. We believe through our interdisciplinary projects, engaging concert programs, music appreciation classes and personal approach, it is possible to break the institutionalized walls of classical music in the 21st century and reach a wider audience including those who are not familiar with the genre.

Read about Classical for All here;

"Striking a chord with the younger generation" New York Press 

http://nypress.com/striking-a-chord-with-the-younger-generation/

And here;

“By staging events in casual, inexpensive venues, they hope to appeal to listeners who may feel put off by the tradition of tuxedo-clad musicians performing in large concert halls.” Our Downtown

http://nypress.com/classical-music-cafe-style-2/

and here;

"Every Sunday afternoon, this veteran pianist plays to a crowd at Caffe Vivaldi. Beyond tickling the ivories, he shares fun facts about the music he plays and the composers who created it. On this Sunday, "Chatty Pianist" as he's known, played selections such as Mozart's Piano Sonata No. 14 in C Minor and Mendelssohn's Rondo Capriccioso.

Not a classical music connoisseur? Trust me, you don't have to be. It's nearly impossible not to be captivated by the music, let alone his charm and passion. Plus, the performance is truly spectacular, and the level you'd hear in a concert hall for a fraction of the price." Tracy's New York Life

www.tracysnewyorklife.com/2016/02/new-york-chatty-pianist-caffe-vivaldi.html

Looking forward to meeting you soon!!

Ege

www.classicalforall.com
results.name: CLASSICAL 4 ALL

results.description:
This is a group where artists can get together and we can share our work to get feedback from other artists. I am located in what is traditionally referred to as South Brooklyn (Cobble Hill, Downtown, Carroll Gardens, Red Hook, Gowanus, Park Slope, etc.  No offense to any neighborhood not listed.  More explanation can be found here: http://www.meetup.com/Brooklyn-Artists/messages/boards/thread/42818652 ) and am looking forward to meeting other artists and exchanging opinions and ideas with you. Meetings will be organized in the area, wherever it turns out appropriate for people to be able to bring their work for feedback. Ideas are welcome!

Members of the Meetup are expected to occasionally attend meetings.  I understand that we all have lives to live and people get busy, but people who sign up and never appear for a meeting with eventually be removed from the group.

<br> Personally, I am a painter with classical realist training. But artists from all media are welcome if you have something to share. Sculptors are welcome (if you can't bring it, bring pics)! Poets and musicians, come share your thoughts and work! 

One thing I ask is that members take RSVP'ing seriously.  Please let us know if you will not be coming to an event that you RSVP'ed "Yes" to. It is appreciated if you could just kindly reply "No" if you have no intention of coming to an event.  It just takes a second, and helps my planning.  Many thanks!

results.description: "Think Positive New York," founded by David Giller and Helene Abrams, is a grass-roots movement for like-minded individuals committed to accelerating positive change in communities throughout the New York region. This multi-platformed approach, now more than three decades in development, testing and implementation in Florida, California and New York, has the potential outreach to help all New Yorkers develop a positive mindset. The premise is simple: Surround everyone with positive reinforcements. Strategies and techniques are in place for people to think more positively, significantly reduce daily stress, and build self-esteem - from the very young to the very old. Programs and tools for individuals, schools, businesses, organizations, the City of New York agencies, institutions, etc. are now in place. The vehicles for doing this involve media projects, the internet, the arts and community programs. Meet-up members have a great opportunity to interact with this tribe in many areas of their lives.
results.name: Think Positive New York!

results.description:
Are you a journalist / blogger / photographer / critic / social media guru? 

Then you've come to the right place! 

This group isn't about "networking." It's about getting to know the community of young journalists living, working, and covering New York City. Also drinking. Media people of all stripes are welcome! 

How to use this group

• Join one of our monthly meetups, special events, or propose your own!

• Share your articles, what you're working on, get feedback

• Ask questions, get advice, talk about what's new in news

• Debate the merits of the Oxford Comma  

Who can join?

• Working journalists, freelancers, journalism students, or anyone who's interested in meeting other journalists in NYC

SPONSOR MESSAGE 
Lyft is currently offering members of our Meetup free ride credit. Visit https://www.lyft.com/invited/JOURNALISTS to get the free credit.
results.name: Journalists NYC

We are all familiar with the difficulty in getting friends to commit to travel and aligning everyone's schedules (job responsibilities, going back to school, family/kids, etc.). This group is for those who know they want to travel, and they are looking for the who and where.

We host monthly gatherings and giveaways (from local sponsors) to connect fellow travelers, make new friends, and perhaps plan your next trip with others. We also put together local day excursions and domestic & international trips, which anyone is welcome to partake in. Our goal is to keep the enthusiasm of travel and camaraderie going strong.

results.description: This is a group for anyone who loves ragtime and traditional jazz. We'll be enjoying live music performances around New York city, particularly following a favorite ragtime piano player, Terry Waldo, a charismatic, long-time veteran of the genre. More info on Terry: Terry Waldo is considered one of America's premier performers and presenters of Ragtime and Early Jazz. Known for his virtuoso ragtime and stride piano playing, charming vocals, and disarming wit, he is the protégé‚ of the legendary Eubie Blake, who called Waldo "an extension of my own musical self." Waldo has played countless New York jazz clubs, including the legendary Cookery, Hanratty’s and Michaels’s Pub where he produced and starred in nine critically acclaimed musical revues. He has appeared in concerts worldwide, including the Grand Parade du Jazz in Venice, George Wein’s JVC Jazz Festival at Carnegie Hall and Jazz At Lincoln Center. He recently appeared with the New York Pops at Carnegie Hall where he performed the world premier of “The Eubie Blake Concerto.”
results.name: New York Ragtime & Traditional Jazz Music Meetup

Why will automating testing help the company make more money? In what ways can a Web Dashboards boost internal efficiency? How can we integrate open source libraries to create remarkable products with remarkable speed? If you have any recommendations or would like to present, please let us know!

Genres include jazz, rock, pop, standards and more, with an emphasis on jazz.  We will have jam sessions for those who play or are learning to play, go to free live concerts, music workshops, Karaoke, open mic night, and anything else we can think of that is music related. Thank you.

results.description:
In this meet up group we will get together for improvisation workshops in New York City Area. Classes will be open to actors and non-actors, and will focus on a genius woman's improvisation technique; the grandmother of Improvisation; Viola Spolin. According to Spolin incorporating game playing into acting training will help actors to get out of their heads and release their creative free selves. So she created "Theater Games" which became the source of the improvisational comedy as we know today through improv groups, of TV shows like Saturday Night Live.

The meet up workshops will help us experience Spolin Games and her method to achieve physical awareness, spontaneity and ensemble building.

"We learn through experience and experiencing. No one teaches anyone anything." Viola Spolin
"My vision is a world of accessible intuition" Viola Spolin

www.spolinist.com/new-york

results.description:
The Relationship Circle

About the Relationship Circle:

The Relationship Circle is an open, honest and safe forum allowing individuals to explore their relationships with themselves and others, while creating community and connection.  The group focuses on relationships and how we relate to each other in the present moment: uncovering the patterns, context and strategies that keep us from being our whole selves in our intimate relationships.

We will dive deep and resurface with the treasures acquired during this process; start the hard work of shifting and transforming our relationships to create positive, healthy and satisfying relationships within our community of friends, family, work and romantic partners.

About Us:

The Relationship Circle began in Washington DC in September of 2011, led and founded by Relationship Coach Gregg DeMammos.  Since then, it has grown to a group with over 400 members meeting regularly to transform people's relationships and lives.  You can find out more about the origin of The Relationship Circle and read blog entries at www.relationshipcircle.com.

Eva Fernandez, is a licensed couples and family therapist (LMFT) Board Certified Coach (BCC).  She trained as a Life and Ontological coach at Accomplishment Coaching, an International Coach Federation (ICF) accredited school and is completing her ICF accreditation.

As a relationship coach and couples therapist, Eva has helped individuals, families, couples and groups break free from negative cycles and patterns that keep them from forming and sustaining loving and healthy relationships. She will be your guide on your journey to wholeness--empowering you to take control of your emotional health and discover how to create those loving and secure relationships we all crave.

My Philosophy:

We all want to be seen and heard--to express ourselves fully and authentically without being judged, shamed, criticized or rejected. Through the group process, you will learn to give yourself permission to express yourself fully in all aspects of your Self, to recognize the good and the healthy, while unraveling the strategies and contexts that keep you stuck. We will partner to uncover that which has been shunned or pushed to the dark and forgotten--those destructive behaviors and unfulfilling relationships that limit your emotional growth.

My way of being and working with you is warm, respectful, authentic, honest and compassionate. As a group facilitator, my role is to facilitate and move the conversation forward, while attending to the group process and your present moment awareness. The power of group lies in the unique opportunity to receive multiple perspectives, support, encouragement and feedback from other individuals in safe and confidential environment. These interpersonal interactions can provide group members an opportunity to deepen their level of self-awareness and to learn how they relate to others. The Relationship Circle can be a safe and supportive place to experiment with new ideas and ways of being. Together we work at creating a space where you can experience profound change rather than merely talking about change.

Group Format:

The format of the groups will often be topic-driven (structured) as a jumping off point to create powerful conversation.  Other times, group members are encouraged to bring in their relationship issues. 

· The group size is limited to 14-16 people

· This is an open group for men and women

NOTE: For those who are interested in deeper work, there is a closed-group that will be running on Wednesday, April 16th, 2014. This is a 12-week commitment group, limited participants of 8-10, harnessing the interpersonal interactions to deepen your interpersonal skills, self-awareness and learn to create deep and powerful connections in your personal and professional life. 




If you have any questions or would like to schedule an intake for this upcoming group, please email or call: Eva Fernandez, LMFT

call: 646.881.4608

E-mail: Info@InnerPathwaysMFT.com


Stay Connected!

Visit Us: at InnerPathwaysMFT.com

Follow Us: @Coach_Eva

Like Us: Facebook
results.name: NYC: The Relationship Circle
